intro: Hibbertia carinata, commonly known as the ridged sand-verbena, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is characterized by its hairy, ribbed stems and bright yellow flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in coastal regions. Hibbertia carinata is a member of the Dilleniaceae family and is known for its drought tolerance. Its unique appearance makes it a popular choice for rock gardens and native plant collections.
